API: Socket.getInputStream()
CODE: InputStream getInputStream() throws IOException
EXPLANATION: The getInputStream() method of the Socket class is used to get the input stream of the socket. If the socket is closed, the method throws an IOException.

In your case, the InputStream returned by Socket.getInputStream() may return null if the socket is closed before the InputStream is obtained. This can happen if the socket is closed before the InputStream is read from. To avoid this, you should always check if the InputStream returned by Socket.getInputStream() is null before calling any methods on it.

```java
Socket socket = new Socket("localhost", 8080);
InputStream inputStream = socket.getInputStream();
if (inputStream != null) {
    // Read from the inputStream
} else {
    // Handle the case where the inputStream is null
}
```

This way, you can ensure that you are not calling methods on a null InputStream, which would result in a NullPointerException.
